image.altText: A 10-metre bare-metal boat with small cabin on the back of a boat trailer.

props.synopsis: Police say they have made Tasmania's largest-ever seizure of cocaine and meth, after intercepting a boat that came ashore in a remote Tasmanian shack community.

title.children: Victorian boat arrival in Tasmanian shack community leads to state's largest cocaine, meth bust

image.altText: A map of some Hobart suburbs with different coloured shapes according to bushfire risk.

props.synopsis: Surrounded by bush and with hills and valleys, the Greater Hobart area presents a challenge for fire preparation. A new tool shows residents the risks they face.

title.children: Hobart faces worsening fire danger. This tool shows which areas are most at risk

image.altText: Dougie's Backpackers damaged by cyclone

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has upgraded Tropical Cyclone Jasper to a category two system, warning it will bring heavy rain and destructive winds to Far North Queensland. Follow live.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Jasper intensifies to category two system

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tropical Cyclone Jasper re-upgraded to category two
WATCH: Bureau of Meteorology's Tropical Cyclone Jasper update

image.altText: Perth test Usman Khawaja

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia says it expects Usman Khawaja to follow rules, after he planned to wear shoes featuring Israel-Gaza war messages during the first test in Perth.

title.children: Cricket Australia pours cold water on Usman Khawaja's shoes showing support for Gaza

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair looks close to tears.

props.synopsis: Angus Llewellyn is facing his second day of cross-examination by Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer, today focusing on alleged contradictory statements Brittany Higgins made during her interview on The Project.

title.children: Producer for The Project questioned about 'inconsistencies' in Brittany Higgins's interview

image.altText: A woman and a man lean over a bench and speak to another woman while a man makes a speech in the background

props.synopsis: There have been some frenzied days in Tasmania's parliament, but this was peak chaos — parliament recalled from summer break to suspend a judge charged with assault and abuse, only for the Liberal government to decide the best option was to do nothing, writes Adam Langenberg.

title.children: Tasmanian parliament suspends itself instead of judge charged with assault

image.altText: a clsoe up portrate of the actor

props.synopsis: American actor Andre Braugher, who starred in television series Brooklyn Nine-Nine and Homicide: Life on the Street, has died aged 61.

title.children: Andre Braugher, star of Brooklyn Nine-Nine, dies aged 61

image.altText: Jim Chalmers speaks at a press conference inside parliament house

props.synopsis: Australians hoping to see their wages grow noticeably in real terms will have to wait longer than expected, with the federal government's budget update showing higher-than-forecast inflation savaging the benefits of higher pay.

title.children: Budget bottom line improves, but few signs of real wage growth as inflation savages benefits of higher pay

image.altText: Barbara Woodward speaks during a meeting of the UN General Assembly.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese joins with leaders from Canada and New Zealand in a joint statement saying "this cannot be one-sided" and condemning both the October 7 Hamas attacks and the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. Follow live.

title.children: World reacts to UN vote calling for ceasefire in Gaza

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Shadow defence minister calls Australia's ceasefire vote "weak leadership"
'Not an outlier': Why Australia sides with New Zealand and Canada
Save the Children worker and family dies in Gaza

image.altText: A landscape image of Jimmy Barnes wearing a black top. The background is out of focus but there is red, orange and blue light

props.synopsis: Musician Jimmy Barnes reveals a bacterial infection he's been battling has spread to his heart.

title.children: Jimmy Barnes to undergo open heart surgery after bacterial infection spreads

image.altText: Man assaulting police officer on ground

props.synopsis: Police were called to a street in Parkwood around 5:35am on Wednesday after a member of the public saw a damaged luxury car parked on the street with two men asleep inside.

title.children: Female police officer in hospital after violent attack on the Gold Coast

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair smiles

props.synopsis: A man who fatally stabbed a young woman in an act of "random violence committed against a stranger" is sentenced to life in prison by a Tasmanian court.

title.children: 'Intentional, purposeful killing' : Man who murdered young Queensland woman in random attack gets life sentence

image.altText: Two paramedics in uniform stand before an ambulance vehicle. They both look serious.

props.synopsis: Paramedics speak of their safety concerns after ambulances are deliberately driven at by stolen cars in Townsville, which is grappling with a youth crime wave.

title.children: Paramedics shaken, QAS concerned for Townsville staff after ambulances targeted by stolen cars

image.altText: an ambulance with messages written on the side reading australias lowest paid paramedics

props.synopsis: The NSW government avoids a collapse of the state's triple-0 system by offering between 11 per cent and 29 per cent pay rises to paramedics over four years.

title.children: NSW paramedics agree to pay increase to avoid mass walkout on January 1

image.altText: A man smiles into the camera. He is wearing a hard hat and is at a work site.

props.synopsis: Jiangang Ji kidnapped the children of his former boss before demanding a $1 million ransom as part of a revenge plot.

title.children: Disgruntled worker who kidnapped ex-boss's children jailed for 22 years over 'abhorrent' revenge crime

image.altText: Two people trying to get out of the rain beside a road in Cairns.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Jasper is expected to cross the coast later this afternoon, bringing with it large swells, storms and life-threatening flash flooding.

title.children: 'This is an evolving situation': Tropical Cyclone Jasper intensifies as Far North Queensland braces for impact

image.altText: Droughty Point proposal composite thumbnail

props.synopsis: Plans to build 2,500 new homes in Hobart fell at the first hurdle earlier this year. But now the project has been given the green light by council, with proponents claiming it will "transform" the area.

title.children: Council greenlights plan to build 2,500 homes on Hobart's eastern shore

image.altText: Two men and two women, one holding a pelican, stand smiling in a beachside park.

props.synopsis: A pelican with a fishing hook stuck in its head that Cairns residents have been desperately trying to help is finally in the hands of carers after a group effort that one local says has restored her faith in humanity.

title.children: Stricken pelican that evaded capture for months finally rescued thanks to Cyclone Jasper

image.altText: Headshots of Christopher Luxon, Anthony Albanese and Justin Trudeau

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese joins the leaders of New Zealand and Canada to issue a rare joint statement calling for "urgent international efforts towards a sustainable ceasefire" in Gaza.

title.children: Albanese joins NZ, Canada leaders in rare joint statement as Australia supports ceasefire vote at UN

image.altText: 12 year old girl being excorted away by security after protesting at COP28.

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old climate activist from India has accused world leaders and authorities at the COP28 climate conference of treating young people's futures as a "joke" after storming onstage to disrupt the event.

title.children: 'They think our future is a joke': 12yo activist slams COP28 after draft agreement omits fossil fuel phase-out

image.altText: Large Christmas wreathes hang over a street filled with boutique stores, and people.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has delivered his mid-year economic and fiscal outlook statement, but what does it mean for interest rates, inflation and households heading into Christmas? Follow live as our business reporters answer your questions on our blog.

title.children: Wondering what the mid-year budget update means ahead of Christmas or why it matters? Our reporters are here to help

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 📺 International events behind boost to budget's bottom line, economist says
Why am I struggling when the budget's doing well?
Treasurer says more cost-of-living relief is not guaranteed in May budget

image.altText: A screen shot from a website streaming Winki Pop surf beach.

props.synopsis: There are cameras right along Australia's east coast providing a glimpse into the day's surf conditions, but some locals on Victoria's Surf Coast believe a recent addition at a surf break near Bells Beach marks a "violation" of the area's values.

title.children: It's a simple shot of rolling waves, but the camera that filmed it is in the centre of a political storm

image.altText: Sky over town of Bright, Victoria with meteors in sky

props.synopsis: Celebrate the end of the year with some fireworks of the celestial kind — this year's Geminid meteor shower could be the best Australia has seen.

title.children: No moon and great timing — just two reasons why this year's Geminid meteor shower will be a total cracker

image.altText: A man smiles.

props.synopsis: Two people have been charged with murder over the death of prominent Adelaide doctor Michael Yung, as his family issues a statement saying his death has "left a hole in our hearts that will never be filled".

title.children: 'Selfless devotion to children': Family pays tribute to Adelaide paediatrician

image.altText: A young man sits at a restaurant table, smiling and giving a thumbs up. Someone off frame has her arm around him.

props.synopsis: Construction management company Stantec pleads not guilty in a Perth court to failing to ensure the safety of apprentice Jonnie Hartshorn, who died when a glass roof collapsed at a Curtin University building site.

title.children: Company charged over death of apprentice on Curtin University site denies failings

image.altText: An out-of-focus photo of school children walking across a bridge from street view.

props.synopsis: A Sydney primary school teacher under investigation for historical child sex abuse allegations is removed from classroom duties after questions are raised by ABC Investigations.

title.children: 'I thought the systems were fool-proof': Woman 'devastated' after learning alleged child abuser still teaching

image.altText: A row of computrers with headphones and one person playing with bright coloured clouds and roses in the background.

props.synopsis: The Electronic Entertainment Expo, known as E3, had been held annually in Los Angeles since 1995 and was a popular spot for game companies to tease their latest creations before they hit store shelves.

title.children: 'More than a trade show': E3, one of the video gaming industry's biggest events, permanently cancelled

image.altText: Caroline Polachek looks up, wearing a dark blue off the shoulder dress in an orange room with unknown objects

props.synopsis: The art-pop wonder delivered both nostalgic and future-focused pop in one stunning package, with a little help from a 90s pop icon.

title.children: Let's unpack Double J's best albums of 2023

countdowns.title: Get personalised music recommendations from Zan Rowe and the Double J team

image.altText: pope francis reads from a text at a service

props.synopsis: In a small but significant change for Catholics, who make up 25 per cent of the Australian population, the Church softens its stance on what families can do with the remains of loved ones.

title.children: The Catholic church has relaxed rules on cremation. Here's what has changed

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios looks to one side

props.synopsis: The mercurial Nick Kyrgios says he no longer wants to play tennis, but is vowing to make a successful comeback from serious injury and bow out on his own terms.

title.children: 'I can't walk without pain': Nick Kyrgios says he does not want to play tennis any more

image.altText: Netball players contest the ball

props.synopsis: Netball Australia's bitter dispute with its players is over, after both parties signed a new three-year pay deal that includes a revenue sharing component.

title.children: Netball Australia ends civil war with players, agrees to 'historic' three-year pay deal

image.altText: Black and white photo of Derek Bromley staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man who has spent nearly 40 years behind bars for a murder he says he did not commit has had his bid for freedom rejected by the High Court.

title.children: Adelaide man Derek Bromley loses High Court bid for freedom

image.altText: White phosphorus fired.

props.synopsis: Israel denies using white phosphorus munitions illegally, but the US says it will be seeking more information after fresh reports emerged linking its use to an attack that injured at least nine civilians. This is what we know.

title.children: 'Nasty weapon of war': What we know about Israel's white phosphorus bombs

image.altText: A composite image of Benjamin Netanyahu and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: In an increasingly troubled world, there are two men who have a clear incentive to keep their wars going – Benjamin Netanyahu and Vladimir Putin, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Two wars, two leaders, one common thread: What Gaza and Ukraine have in common

image.altText: US President Joe Biden shakes hands with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with US President Joe Biden and other senior politicians to discuss US support for Ukraine's war effort.

title.children: 'We're gonna stay at your side': Biden tells Zelenskyy not to give up hope in war against Russia
